author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon that land where Christ once trod, Biden hath landed with gentle nod,
In Gaza's midst, a deadly bloom, forebode of escalating doom. 
Beneath the heavens, silent plea, for peace 'twixt Hamas and Jewry.

In China, silver streets now shine, from ore's strong pulse through the mine,
Their coffers flow, with metals fair, amidst the world's vitriolic air. 
For gold doth rise, as tensions mount, its value an unsteady count.

Amidst the clash of swords uncouth, the vats of oil proclaim the truth,
For Gaza's fires doth cause alarm, in markets fraught with uneasy calm.
'Tis oil and blood, mix'd sanguine flood, that maketh the price of Gaza's blood.

feedItems.title: Biden Lands in Israel to Meet Leaders on Hamas War
feedItems.description: The president arrived a day after a deadly blast at a hospital in Gaza demonstrated the volatility of the conflict and heightened fears of escalation.

feedItems.title: Metals Rise on Stronger China Economic Data
feedItems.description: Base metals prices pushed higher as China data showed the economy fared better than expected in the third quarter, while safe-haven demand triggered by geopolitical tension kept gold prices elevated.

feedItems.title: Oil Climbs on Rising Tensions in Israel-Hamas Conflict
feedItems.description: Oil prices moved higher in Europe, with worries over the conflict in Gaza intensifying late Tuesday.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In whispered warnings, the greenback slumbers,
Despite constant coaxing from valorous numbers.
Yet lower it may fall, whispers foretell,
Beseeching the trend, by its cruel spell.

In early morn, bond yields high they rose,
In Eurozone halls, where safe harbor goes.
No siren's call of safety stirs their rest,
'Tis the analyst's will, he who knows best.

China, fair phoenix, twixt struggle and rise,
With stimulus aid to claim the prize.
Yet doubters do warn of winds harsh and cold,
From fickle hearts and real estate's hold.

feedItems.title: Dollar Edges Lower, Could Fall Further as Momentum Builds
feedItems.description: The dollar was slightly lower, shrugging off higher Treasury yields and stronger-than-expected U.S. retail sales, and it could continue to drop as this weaker trend gains momentum, MUFG said.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise, Lack Renewed Safety Bids
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose in early trading, extending Tuesday’s moves in the absence of a renewed safety bid, according to analysts.

feedItems.title: China's Economy Gets Boost From Stimulus, but Headwinds Grow
feedItems.description: China’s economy is likely to struggle for a while yet, economists say. Real estate remains a major risk and consumer confidence is fragile.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Lieth Handelsbanken 'gainst profit's rise,
Yet halt does whale of economy's prize,
Interest in sky, volumes in demise,
The rabbit in its burrow, no surprise. 

Next, Volvo, sturdy steed of steel,
Sees lessened market, softens its deal,
Like goats on mountain's peak do feel,
Fall of orders makes the future real. 

Last, U.K., in monetary pleas,
Holds inflation, like snail 'gainst seas.
The hawk, BOE, in anxious breeze,
Aims to tame the wind among the trees.

feedItems.title: Handelsbanken Tops Hopes as Income Rises
feedItems.description: Handelsbanken posted a third-quarter profit that beat expectations, as net interest income rose to SEK12.2 billion, but said the slowdown in the economy and higher interest rates caused growth in deposit and lending volumes to level off.

feedItems.title: Volvo Sees Lower Truck Market Levels in 2024
feedItems.description: Volvo posted forecast-beating third-quarter earnings but said order intake fell 27%, reflecting a normalization of demand, with truck markets seen weakening next year.

feedItems.title: U.K. Inflation Holds Steady
feedItems.description: Consumer prices in the U.K. rose 6.7% in September, matching the previous month’s rise and complicating the task of the BOE as it looks to keep bringing inflation down.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the fourth quarter of ABB's company so grand,
Forecasts fell, like gales to a sail, unplanned.
Guidance came kin to a sword’s dulling band,
Whilst Citi foretells downgrades in the scriveners' hand.

Third-quarter harvest of ABB did yield,
Less than the bounty the seers had field.
Yet, they predict a fourth quarter shield,
Where stronger revenues and margins are sealed.

Tele2's figures, like runes in the sand,
Echoed forecast's hope, with a firm standing hand.
Earnings like warriors, increased by a band,
Guidance maintained, as strong as a Norseman's command.

feedItems.title: ABB's 4Q Guidance Seen Below Expectations
feedItems.description: ABB’s guidance for the fourth quarter came in slightly below consensus expectations, which may result in minor downward revisions, Citi said.

feedItems.title: ABB Misses Views; Sees Improved Fourth Quarter
feedItems.description: ABB reported third-quarter profit and revenue below forecasts, but said it expected an operational core earnings margin of around 16% and higher revenue growth in the final quarter of the year.

feedItems.title: Tele2 Keeps Outlook as Third Quarter Meets Hopes
feedItems.description: Tele2 posted third-quarter results largely in line with expectations, with underlying earnings up 3%, and maintained its full-year and midterm guidance.
